$GOOGL just dropped its 7th-gen TPU â€˜Ironwoodâ€™ & itâ€™s a monster.

Itâ€™s built for massive AI workloads & plugs directly into Google Cloud which gives them full control over how their models are trained & deployed.

The shift to AI-driven compute means hyperscalers arenâ€™t renting GPUs anymore so theyâ€™re building their own silicon to train faster and run cheaper.

Whoever owns the hardware owns the economics of AI & compute is the new currency.

I opened two new positions this week in the growth portfolio. 

Both companies are under $2B in market cap. Any guesses?

$NVDA CEO Jensen Huang said AI demand continues to accelerate â€œmonth by monthâ€ and that heâ€™s asked $TSM for more wafer supply. 

Speaking in Taiwan, he emphasized TSMCâ€™s importance to Nvidiaâ€™s success, saying, â€œNo TSMC, no Nvidia.â€

$BN CEO Bruce Flatt, who oversees over $1T in assets across real estate, infrastructure & energy, says weâ€™re not in a bubble but weâ€™re entering a build cycle.

He emphasized that the companies driving this era have balance sheets stronger than many nations & are locking in long-duration, hard assets with 10+ years of cash flow visibility at fixed financing costs.

Between AI compute demand, electrification & population growth the global power capacity will need to expand by over 25K terawatt-hours in the next 15 years.

The market keeps calling it overvalued but the truth is weâ€™re underbuilt.

Told my wife I started shopping early for Black Friday. 

She rolled her eyes when she realized I meant adding to $MELI, $META, $SOFI, $CIFR & $BMNR.

Most people crave control but markets are designed to remind you that you never had it in the first place.

The only real control is your framework.

If you know why you own something and that reason hasnâ€™t changed then the red on the screen is just noise.

Market still values Meta like a cyclical ad platform even though it has evolved into one of the largest AI compute platforms on earth built inside the most engaged network ever created.

Meta now reaches 3.5B people every day, Reels monetization is scaling with time spent already above Facebook Feed & its AI agents are about to turn every app in the family into a discovery & commerce engine.

20x forward earnings for a company compounding like this makes no sense so Iâ€™ll keep adding while everyone else hesitates.

JFC

5/6

Fortunately, some at the Fed do "get it."

3/6

For comparison, the opposite happened in the 2010s. The cumulative gain in wages (blue) beat the cumulative rise in prices (orange). 

In this scenario, the bottom 50% of wage earners were able to make ends meet and maybe get a little ahead, as their paychecks bought a bit more each year.

2/6

Why the anger?

Since the COVID recession ended in April 2020, cumulative price increases (orange) have outpaced cumulative wage increases (blue). 

This devastates the bottom 50% of wage earners (and especially the bottom 30%) who own no assets and live paycheck-to-paycheck. They are having to do with less.

1/6

The preliminary November University of Michigan Consumer Sentiment Survey was released this morning (blue). The "current conditions" measure of this survey set a new ALL-TIME LOW.

Before 2020 (COVID), the stock market (red) was the primary driver of the public's economic outlook. These two series moved up and down together. Since COVID, this relationship has completely disconnected.

This leads to some uncomfortable explanations.

Half of the country owns no assets and lives paycheck to paycheck. Have they now moved to being angry at a booming stock market that worsens inequality?  Is this why socialists are getting elected? Do they want their agenda to knock the market down? Is a bear market now the goal, not the concern?

I'm not saying the silliness is over, but when the silliness is over, this is the chart that cracks:

High Beta versus Low Volatility

This ratio measures risk appetite:

* Rising ratio â†’ High Beta outperforming Low Vol, i.e., a â€œrisk-onâ€ regime.

* Falling ratio â†’ Low Vol outperforming, i.e., â€œrisk-offâ€ or defensive positioning.

The Ratio Is at a Multi-Decade High. The current reading (2.31) approaches or exceeds prior peaks:

* 2007 peak (right before the GFC)
* 2018â€“2021 meme-stock peak
* 2023â€“2024 AI boom

Today's level appears to be the highest since at least 2006.
